alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 5:47AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Le Flore County through 630 AM CDT... At 547 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Heavener to 5 miles southwest of Whitesboro to 13 miles west of Octavia. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Heavener... Octavia... Heavener Runestone State Park... Whitesboro... Muse... Big Cedar... Hodgen... Honobia... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma.
